headline: Bacon-Wrapped Jalapeño Poppers
description: These jalapeño poppers are filled with a blend of cream cheese and Cheddar cheese in this easy to make, crowd-pleasing, bacon-wrapped appetizer.

video.description: Creamy, cheesy, spicy bite-size party appetizers.
video.name: Bacon-Wrapped Jalapeno Poppers

name: Bacon-Wrapped Jalapeño Poppers
recipeIngredient: 12 jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise, seeds and membranes removed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Mix cream cheese and Cheddar cheese together in a bowl until evenly blended. Fill each jalapeño half with cheese mixture. Put halves back together and wrap each stuffed pepper with a slice of bacon. Arrange bacon-wrapped peppers on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until bacon is crispy, 25 to 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I don't slice my jalapeno's in half. I have a jalapeno coring tool that i got on Amazon that I think is a lot better than cutting them in half. You can use the tool to cut off the top and core the jalapeno, and then you just rinse out the remaining seeds, stuff, wrap, and either bake, grill offset, or smoke them. I have some in the oven right now, just at a lower heat because dinner is not for a few hours.

Great recipe but a big fyi when you slice the jalapenos in half make sure you line up the halves together otherwise you have the jalapenos not matching up when you put them back together. Learned that for the second time I made.

We love jalapenos here. Some bite more than others! We chopped them up in lots of things tuna and egg salad Just cream cheese in crackers lol Wrapped with bacon- these are absolutely the best. You have to like heat! pre cooking bacon helps to make cooking time shorter if serving as appetizers. I saw someone else suggest. Pre-cook your jalapenos some before stuffing and wrapping too. To save you time. Then stuff cover and wouldn't take too long to bake grill or fry when ready. So you can spend more time with family or friends!! Just saying Enjoy the moment Thank you for sharing this recipe Always a favorite in our house!
Easy and impressive while delish Five stars across the board

Great Recipe. I pre- cook my bacon till it's about half done, then wrap the poppers and cook them the rest of the way. Also, I like to sprinkle the poppers with a little pure maple syrup just before baking.
The absolute best. Rich, creamy, spicy. I like to add a bit of garlic to the cheese mixture, just one more layer of flavor.
My mom went for seconds it was amazing

In West Texas (the area, not the town of West :-)) we call these Armadillo eggs and they are usually cooked on a grill. My late Aunt Charlotte stuffed them with everything from cream cheese and scallions, to pimento cheese and salad shrimp. Thanks for the memory!
For something a bit different cook them in the smoker.

This recipe is very easy to make and so good! I decided to not put together the halves and wrapped one piece of bacon around each half. I cooked mine about 40 minutes and the bacon turned out crispier. I drizzled a bit of bbq sauce on some and they tasted great. This recipe is a family favorite now! Definitely use plastic gloves when scraping seeds out!
This recipe was excellent I’ve made it many times but I can’t always remember the baking time… thanks to all recipes I get a reminder of how long to bake it… Turned out excellent thank you!!
Delicious I cooked an extra 5 mins to cook bacon crispy

Made these a dozen times in the oven and air fryer ... always good. Usually make them with thick cut bacon (using a a few toothpicks to hold bacon in position) and garlic and herb Goat cheese. Simple to make and great flavor.
These were easy to make and good!! I also used cream cheese and chives, very tasty also
A party favorite, and I really appreciate not having to read some treacly prose about how your grandmother fixed this on the last bacon holiday, or some such.
Instead of cheddar, I mixed a parmesan and ranch spice to the cream cheese, and wrapped each half with bacon. YUM! 😋
I tried with small sweet peppers instead of jalapeños and they were delicious!
I did not put the halves together again - even yummier!
OUTSTANDING! BEST I'VE EVER EATEN, EASY TO PREPARE.
wear gloves don't touch the jalapeños during prep

Phenom! These were a huge HUGE hit and now I will have to make them forever and ever. I used 8 medium jalapeños halved and did not put them back together. I used more cream cheese and cheddar so I could be generous with the stuffing. Thin hickory smoked bacon, half a slice wrapped around each half pepper. Baked a full 40 min with a quick broil at the end to sear the bacon. Served with my homemade salsa ranchera. Bam!! The picture attached is the “before” and there is no “after” pic since they were devoured as soon as they came out of the oven!
Loved them
These are Fantastic!

I love this recipe too! I keep coming back to it every year. One important reminder everybody trying this recipe needs is: Always Wear Gloves to Cut Jalapeños. I won’t ever make that mistake again, LOL
Loved it might try adding other seasonings next time
From Brenda, This was so spicy it hurt my tongue to even take a bite out of it I had to get a good glass of cold milk although this was pretty good
We absolutely love these! Easy to make and no deep fryer in our house- so was the perfect recipe.
Great and easy! My 19 year old son LOVE THESE! I leave the seeds in but I would not recommend it if you are sensitive to spicy!!! Must try!
Loved it !!! ❤️
Yummy!
I added a dash of onion granules and garlic powder. Great and easy recipe,
Tasted Great. Made while camping

Turned out amazing as always. The only thing I don't do is add the extra cheese, but I will be trying that next time I make these! Honestly just needed the temperature and time to put them in, but I recommend this recipe to anyone who hasn't tried it yet!

They are great! I used an air fryer and I think that is the key in why so many people haven’t been successful with this recipe. The only thing I will do differently next time, is I precook the jalapeños first. I like my jalapeños a little more done than what they came out, but they are delicious.
Excellent, yes must cook for 30 minutes.

These were delicious, and easy. I learned a few things the first time - the filling may or may not be enough if the jalapeños are larger. If they're larger then they've spent more time on the vine, they're going to be hotter, too, in spite of removing seeds and ribs. Be forewarned. For the comfort of my guests, and to be more of a "tidbit" size, I'll look for smaller peppers going forward. Mine were about three bites each.

Also, without thinking I used thick sliced bacon (which I'd par cooked to be sure it was just right) and it's a little unwieldy for winding around the pepper. I won't make that mistake again.

And though it doesn't state in the recipe (that I noticed), I think it helps to secure the little baby with a toothpick. Just don't forget to the guests.

These were delicious. So much better than any store bought nosh. I'd make again in a heartbeat.
Great recipe! Very smoky and flavorful! Tastes great! Would recommend!
Delis.

Blended the cream cheese, cheddar, salt,
Pepper. Added smoked paprika, doubled the cream cheese and cheddar for 20 poppers. Wrapped the bacon and sprinkled cheddar on top - 425 oven for 12 min. This is what I always do and I get asked to make it over and over.

Try in an air fryer at 400 for about ten minutes. Open it up and check how done the bacon is. If you want it cooked more, put in back in and check every couple of minutes. I just used half of the pepper for each and did not put them back together before wrapping the bacon. Make sure all seeds and veins are out before cooking. If you are unsure what the veins are, just Google it.

I love making Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos and came here to double check the temp and times of my cooking to see if it was good. This was very helpful and the pictures of the dish looked amazing. The poppers turned out great. I did read a comment or two on here stating that the poppers were too spicy. While I love spicy, my husband doesn't as much. So to help cut back on the heat I wanted to write to help others as well.

Not saying no one did these but it helps a lot if you haven't. Normally I open the jalapenos and remove all the seeds and the white parts of the jalapeno (the veins), after that I throw all of my jalapenos into cold water and leave them soaking for 10 minutes, then I get rid of that water and re-soak them for another 5 giving it some agitation to loosen up any seeds and to dilute the capsaicin (chemical responsible for spice) in the jalapenos. and if you want to be extra sure during the first rinse add some vinegar into the water, probably 1/10th of the water used and the vinegar will help further reduce the heat. That will make your experience better, just make sure to agitate the jalapenos a little more during the second soak if you use vinegar to lose any vinegar taste. Hope this helps anyone looking to take out the punch out of these amazing Jalapeno poppers.

I make these all the time, but agree definitely 15 minutes isn’t even close. I guess it depends how “crunchy” you like your peppers. Agree with previous posts - the heat totally depends on how well you cleaned the jalapeños. I use the small end of a melon baller to scrape the inside of mine when cleaning. Gets out all the white!
I had to double the cheese amounts because the jalapenos a neighbor gave us were HUGE!! The taste was divine. Loved it!
Turned out great. Next time I’ll leave the seeds.

Great recipe! I changed it some by adding bacon bits in the cream cheese cheddar mix and then keeping the jalapeño halves separated and putting more shredded cheddar on top. I skipped the wrapping in bacon step and baked them in a 400° oven for 20-25 minutes watching to be sure the cheese doesn’t burn.

This was too high fat for my taste. Here's my version:
Stuff the jalapenos with salmon or chicken instead of cheese.
I wanted this as an entrée, with rice, so I lined the pan with parchment paper, then tore up some curly leaf kale and put it on top of the paper. Then I laid the stuffed jalapenos on top of the kale and baked per directions, although I had to bake it about 10 min. longer. The kale came out crispy and made a nice side to the peppers. The kale didn't absorb much grease either, but I did use good quality uncured bacon.
Very good. Mine took a little longer and I broiled the last 5 minutes too to crisp the bacon or so but these are the greatest snacks, even cold the next day.
Delicious and very simple recipe. But did anyone else notice the recipe says bake for 15 min and the video says 30 min? Just wondering.

These were really, really tasty. Spice was perfect. I did feel like the stuffing could use more texture. Next time I'd like to try and add a bit more of a twist. I've been really liking spicy ramen lately so something like that could be interesting.

My jalapenos were large so it took about 10 extra minutes to bake them. I also like to broil them for a few minutes at the end to make the bacon crispy. Sometimes I add taco or cajun seasoning to the cream cheese mixture and I prefer maple bacon to cut some of the heat. Great recipe. Using gloves during prep is imperative! Enjoy!
Everyone loved these and I will make them again
Delicious! I cooked them for the amount of time suggested and then broiled them for about 3-5mins and they were perfect.
Sprinkled Cajun spices on top of bacon. Didn’t really change anything
Not a dan of spicy but made this for someone who is and he said its not too bad. Made sure to remove seeds and wash well

I baked for 30 minutes at 400 degrees to get the bacon crispy and to fully cook the jalapeños. Half were stuffed with cream cheese and the other half with a combo of cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Both were delicious. Next time I’m going to try stuffing with sausage and wrap with thick cut bacon.
Loving this recipe! It is simple and easy yet delicious! Not everything in life should be complicated!

These were amazing! I did take the advice of another review and cooked the bacon halfway first. I also added my own spices to the cheese mixture: Garlic Powder, Onion Powder, Cumin, Salt & Pepper. First time I ever made them. Uhhhmazing! Im so full. Thank you!

I followed recipe, except I added garlic powder to my cheese mix. I cooked them longer, more like 30 minutes and then broil at the end for 5. I also had thick cut bacon, so that could be why I cooked longer. But husband and kids said they were delicious! Thanks
Very good recipe. Cheese mixture didn't ooze out. Bake time needs to be changed to at least 30 minutes with turning them over half way through so the bacon is evenly cooked.
Easy and yummy! For the cheddar I had a bag of shredded cheddar and Monterey lack, and used that with the cream cheese. Super good! Baked them for 30 min at 385 and then broiled for 3.5 minutes
Wonderful!

I make these all the time and everybody loves them. I have passed this recipe along many times. The only adjustment I make is I leave them cut in half and then wrap the bacon around them and cook them that way. The cheese doesn’t ooze out that way. They usually do take longer to cook than the 15 min.

I loved making this! It was so easy that I was surprised. I converted the recipe to fix 14 whole peppers. I also added garlic and herb seasoning and chives to the cheese. I did reduce the bacon to about a half a slice to wrap the whole pepper in. I cooked 40 mins, and broiled for about 7 mins. I will do these again!!!
I was looking for a popper recipe that didn't require frying and this fit the bill. The only problem I has was with the cheese leaking out of the top. Next time I'll bake them with the caps on.

I loved this recipe. I would only add a little salt to the filling, as the bacon I have been getting is not as salty as it used to be. Also, it took more like 45 minutes altogether. But, they are really delicious! Great recipe.
Add some finely diced onion to the cheese mixture for a great flavor addition.

Conical shape of the pepper makes the bacon slip off. I couldn't eat them. I pulled them out of the oven and laid each half, face side up, cut the bacon in half and top the peppers. Back in the oven for an additional 10 minutes because the peppers were still under cooked. But then they were delicious easy to eat.
no changes yes I will make it again
I love bacon wrapped jalapeños. I added garlic and veggie seasoning to the cream cheese as well as the cheddar cheese. 12-15 minutes in the air fryer on*370. They were delicious.

Super Easy, Tasty &quick
I used turkey bacon worked fine. Poppers fresh picked so they’re really hot. Cream cheese and sharp cheddar is a nice mix & just enough to offset the pepper heat. Good recipe
I made this for a family get together. My daughter liked it so much she made it for an office potluck. Fav reviews at the office as well. Thank you so much for this recipe!
I seasoned the cream cheese and cheddar cheese.
I love these. I sprinkle some Brown sugar on some of them before I broil them off. I also cut bacon love ways to wrap with patterns
I used Turkey Bacon & baked them in convection oven for convenience. However, I had to add more time to soften the peppers. We will definitely make these again.
Super easy! I loved it! Cooked longer for crispy bacon. 30 minutes.

These are great. My family always requests Bacon wrapped jalapeños at every family event. I've been making these for over 15 years. I like using either jalapeno cream cheese or chive and onion. The trick to the peppers being too hot does not stop at just removing the seeds and veins, if you don't like overwhelming spicy jalapenos, it is imperative that you run them under COLD water for a few minutes. Trust me this is the trick. It takes about 40 minutes at 350 to make the peppers nice and soft and nice crispy bacon.
This was excellent. Made it per the instructions and it was fantastic!
We loved these. Super easy to make and turned out great. It does take longer than 15 minutes to cook. I had to give it about 30 minutes but it may have been my oven. Regardless, they were good.
So good.
Mine aren't pretty but they taste amazing
Needed to bake in the oven for 25 minutes, not 15.
So delicious looking. Cant wait to try. Came out perfecto.
Outstanding. I used Italian breadcrumbs and some granulated garlic.

These are little amazing nuggets of deliciousness!!! I made these exactly as prep called for in the recipe except I cut my bacon in half & wrapped each 1/2 of jalepeño in a 1/2 piece of bacon. Then I cooked them in the air fryer for 9 minutes. These are so delicious that I’m excited for the fact that I have enough ingredients to make an entire 2nd batch to freeze for later! Thank you for a perfect recipe to add to my collection ??
I had to put under the broiler for 4 minutes to crisp up the bacon.
I kept the jalapeño halves separate, and wrapped with halved strips of bacon. Baked for 25 minutes; broiled for 5 minutes. Came out perfect!
Great recipe. So easy. Everyone loved this!
Great taste and simple to make! My husband couldn't get enough of them!
I made no changes in the ingredients but followed others advice and microwaved the jalapeños for one minute before stuffing. They are absolutely delicious!
These were fantastic and I will definitely be making again. I did add garlic and a splash of liquid smoke to the cheese mixture. Rave reviews in my house. Thanks for the recipe!
I half cooked bacon first and they came out perfect following recipe, aI real people pleaser. Jalapeño poppers were gone within the hour
Delishes! Easy to make..definitely a keeper..

Great recipe, although IMO the "12 slices of bacon" was optimistic. It takes almost a full slice of bacon to wrap half a jalapeno, and the recipe calls for 12 jalapenos -- which is 24 halves. It took me much closer to 24 slices of bacon to wrap all the poppers.

As others have noted, the 400F for 15 minutes is wildly optimistic. 400 in my oven took almost 45 minutes to cook them. I did make a second batch in a convection oven, and then ~20 minutes at 400 was enough.

Other changes: 1) I pushed a small slice of garlic into the cream cheese of each popper. That worked great. 2) I also made a batch where I pushed a very small chunk of BBQ brisket (1/4" x 1/4" x 1") into the cream cheese (along with the garlic). These things were awesome. My guests preferred them greatly over the ones without the brisket.

I will definitely be making these again...
i only used 6 peppers,as they were a bit large. I still had enough filling though
These are great! I modified it a bit. I mixed cheese and cream cheese for the filler. I also added hot pepper jelly on the top on the bacon. Delicious!
These poppers turned out wonderful. I will make them often.

We have this often at our house during the summer and we put them on the grill. If your Jalapeno seems to hot then try this; Clean Jalapeno well under cool water removing all of the insides then soak the pepper halves in chilled water for about 10 minutes before drying them out and stuffing them. This will help to take the heat out of your pepper.
Prepared as directed. Fabulous! Better than most restaurants.
